description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the elevation of privilege vulnerability in the Windows ancillary function driver for winsock (CVE-2024-43563), the following updates should be applied to your system based on the build number:

1. Identify your Windows version and architecture (32-bit or 64-bit).
2. Download and install the appropriate KB update from the official Microsoft catalog for your system:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: [KB5044286](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044286)

**Details**:
- This update specifically addresses the issue related to improper memory locking, which could be exploited for elevation of privilege.
- Ensure your system is running a compatible build number:
   - 10.0.26100.2033 for Windows 11 Version 24H2
   - 10.0.22631.4317 for Windows 11 Version 23H2
   - 10.0.19045.5011 for Windows 10 Version 22H2
   - 10.0.19044.5011 for Windows 10 Version 21H2.

**Preconditions**:
- Backup your data prior to installing updates.
- Ensure you have administrative rights to apply the updates.
